Key Match Events: Manvir Singh stung the gloves of Mauritius goalkeeper Kevin Jean-Louis with a left-footed shot from a narrow angle.
Dyllan Collard laid the ball near the edge of the box for Emmanuel Vincent, who blasted a first-time shot a few inches above Amrinder Singh's crossbar.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored India to win based on their current form.
Manolo MÃ¡rquez emphasized the importance of controlling midfield possession.
Post-Match Reflections: Mauritius held on for a vital point, and their skipper and defender Lyndsay Rose was named the player of the match.
AIFF President Shri Kalyan Chaubey presented him with a cheque of Rs. 1,00,000.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hyderabad crowd, witnessing the Blue Tigers after 16 years, cheered loudly for every pass from the get-go.
Syria will now take on Mauritius on September 6 before meeting India on September 9.
Others: India kept the lion's share of the possession but lacked the cutting edge in attack against the 179th-ranked visitors, who defended resolutely to claim a valuable point.
It was a game of few chances, with only one shot on target by each side in the entire 90 minutes.
